reviewText: Let me start out this review by saying that I put off trying this workout for a long time because I had tried several other workouts with this instructor (Sara Ivanhoe) and hadn't liked them.  However, this has quickly become one of my favorite workouts, causing me to want to try some more of her workouts in the future.This workout is focused on relaxing your body and stretching it out.  Therefore, if you're looking for a yoga routine to tone your body, this might not be the best one for you.  The moves in this workout are slow-paced stretching moves that open, relax, and massage the entire body.  Nothing is challenging strength-wise, and this workout should be accessible to all fitness levels-beginner to advanced.  If you're extremely not flexible like me, there are many modifications provided and many people doing them with you so that you don't feel intimidated.  As Sara says, it's really about doing what feels good for your body and not trying to push yourself at all.This program is so flowing that you'll barely notice when you move from one yoga post to another.  There is still such a variety of poses offered with balancing, twisting, or stretching being included in most of them.  It is definitely a yoga workout, but at the same time it's also a stretching workout, making it a perfect alternative to many stretching DVDs.I highly recommend this workout to everyone! Regardless of your level, gender, age, etc. this workout will relax you.  It says on the back that it may even make you sleep better; and after doing this workout, I always fall asleep immediately after.  It has become one of my new favorite workouts, and I don't see myself getting bored from it anytime in the near future.
summary: The most relaxing workout I have ever done!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Today was my first attempt at yoga and i popped in this video.  I have to say that i was very pleased.  I found that i could do all of the stretches in this video, either the 'real' pose or the modified.  i felt a good stretch and my body loosen up in tight areas.  this video starts out with an explaination on how to breathe and that yoga should always be practiced on an empty stomache (something i never knew).  Sarah is very soothing and motivating without being annoying.  i have been practicing pilates for a few months and i find that combining this video and my pilates tapes make for a perfect workout.  i start out with the candlelight yoga video (the full 45 min one), then i move onto a move heart pumping/burning pilates video, i reccommend Burn & Firm pilates and i then do a segment from the Pick your Spot Pilates (ab, thigh, or buns) for extra toning and stretching out at the end of my workout.  I not only reccommend Candlelight Yoga i also reccomment Pick your Spot pilates and Burn & firm pilates.  Pilates is very similar to yoga in that it focuses on breathing (in and out of the nose deeply), stretching and fluid movements to improve flexibility.  so if you enjoy Yoga try pilates, you wont be disappointed!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I just watched 5 instant videos on relaxing type yoga bf buying.  This one is the one!  FINALLY!  This is what yoga  should be - slow,  but not too slow. Smooth, lots of breathing, spiritual and only 30 mins.  I have been longing for just the right combination.  The music is calming but not weird.  The instructor's voice was perfect and the poses simple yet effective.  I didnt get the morning routine with the instant video so cant comment on that but im sure its just as good.  I have fibromyalgia and this kind of  relaxing yoga is just what the doctor ordered.  Literally!!

reviewText: I knew this was a gentle practice, but had no idea how much so.  It is pretty much all breathing and some very gentle stretches.  You only get as far as downward dog once.  I like Sara Ivanhoe's other DVD practices, but this one just is not my cup of tea.  Maybe it would be good for seniors or very inflexible people who just want help relaxing and no exercise at all, but that's not what I'm looking for.
Title: N/A

reviewText: You'll unwind and drain your tension away with this soothing, restorative yoga program. You'll melt anxiety into tranquility with yoga postures specifically chosen to release tension, increase strength, improve balance and enhance flexibility. Don't let the candles fool you. You can do this workout any time as a personal "pick me up." The emphasis on breathing and meditation will help you feel recharged and renewed and will even help you sleep better. There is more to health than being thin or fit. A little yoga every day is the best R & R you can wish for.
Title: N/A

reviewText: As the title of the video suggests, this is a soothing and relaxing yoga practice which instructor Sara Ivanhoe teaches in a calm and non-mystical manner.  The practice begins in a seated position, and Sara takes time to explain yoga breathing and to allow for practice.  This is followed by gentle seated stretches and twists, all the while focused on smooth, relaxing breathing.  Next comes a slow-moving sun salutation series with simplified versions of most poses--eg, Eagle pose done with arms only, not legs.  Sara includes lunges, balancing, and simple backbends but leaves out other classic standing poses such as Warrior and Triangle.  Following the standing series, the practice returns to the floor for some seated forward bends, and finally, there is a relaxation series at the end.Sara is an easy-going instructor who frequently encourages you to go only as far as comfortable and not to strain; she lead a class of students who show various levels of modifications.  The video is set in a Crunch studio, and although there are candles, it is bright with other lighting; the music is soft and in the background.  At just under 45 minutes, this is a perfect yoga practice for unwinding at the end of the day or any other time you need to relax.
summary: A relaxing yoga practice with a strong emphasis on breath
Title: N/A

reviewText: This video features a kinder, gentler yoga- lots of slow stretches that feel great at the end of the day.  The instructor gives clear instructions and the music is lovely and unintrusive. I don't count this as an actual workout- there is nothing strenous in this video, but it helps to get out the "kinks" and eliminates back pain due to tight muscles.  This video leaves me feeling so relaxed, that I usually do this before bedtime.  Overall, a good addition to your video library.

reviewText: This is the best of Sara's instructions. I disagree with the other person who said Crunch The Perfect Yoga Workout is better. Yes they are similar, but I this one is better. Flows better. The music is lovely with nature/bird sounds in the background. My only complaint is with Natasha. She is supposed to be beginner level, but demonstrates with extreme flexibility. It would be better if they used a beginner. She also seems rather stuck-up while Sara and the other students are real people. I own several of Sara's DVDs and all of them are wonderful. The new Yoga on the Ball DVD is great too! Thanks Sara!Check my other review on Amazon for the best choices in exercise and yoga DVDs. Thanks!

reviewText: This is a great yoga DVD for the absolute beginner. This routine is a great introduction to yoga, if you never have tried it before. In this DVD, Sara Ivanhoe moves you gently through each position with clear instruction on body movement and breath (the foundation of yoga practice).The atmosphere and music is peaceful and pleasant, but not distracting. There is also an option on the DVD that allows you to have Sara instruct without the background music so you can use your own music.As an absolute beginner, I tried the Rodney Yee and Yoga Journal's DVD's when I first started and I was overwhelmed. The quick shifts from pose to pose were frustrating and intimidating as a beginner. Sara Ivanhoe's instruction is paced so you can actually get into the pose and stretch through it. Even if you cannot touch your toes at first, you will be able to recieve the benefits from yoga in this DVD. If you have never had a yoga class, and are new to yoga, this is a good DVD to try.
summary: Excellent for Beginner- Relaxing and Refreshing
Title: N/A

reviewText: This yoga workout is perfect for de-stressing and relaxing at the end of the day.  Since it is a gentle practice, it is appropriate for even beginners.  However, there is not a great deal of time devoted to instruction in between poses; each pose flows into the other.  So if you have never done yoga before, you may want to watch it all the way through before attempting to do it, or try a more instructionally focused DVD to begin with.From the picture on the cover and the title, I figured the set would be softly lit for this practice.  Not so.  It was brightly lit and airy, but candles were everywhere.  Although it was not what I expected, the set was still nice to look at.  There are several stretches that are done with eyes closed or facing the ground, though, so you won't be looking at the set all that much.The music is gorgeous, new agey with nature sounds such as birds chirping and flowing water.  This helps to set the tranquil mood.The poses consist of stretches, nothing too strenuous.  Some include the cat stretch, forward bends, and a brief vinyasa (movement flowing with breath).  At the end of the workout, I felt amazingly relaxed and healthy.

reviewText: This is a great evening time relax yoga. There's some strain however it's more for meditation and gentle movement. The instructor has a really nice way about her as she takes you through this workout.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I know all back issues are different, so I cannot recommend or not recommend this for others to use.  I know what my issues are, follow instructions from my doctor pertaining to my limitations and guidelines that I am to follow.  There were several poses that I could not do, or caused further, painful, aggravation of my injuries that I was not told would cause a problem. Just be very careful.  One of the poses on the floor I had to come out of and just roll onto my side for several minutes until I could move again.  I have done other yoga videos and not had any issues. It's not a bad video by any means, just not for me.  My advise is to "be careful", from my back to yours.  :)
summary: Okay if you do not have back issues
Title: N/A

reviewText: This seemed as though it would be perfect.  I need a short morning routine because I'm too rushed before work, and then a longer PM routine because I'm too wound up to sleep.  It had great reviews so I Netflixed it.  I've found this dvd to be highly overrated.  So glad I rented before buying!The energizing session- no sun salutation!  I don't think I've ever encountered that!  It definitely felt like something was missing.  Even the 10 minute AM session from YogaWorks has a sun salutation!  It is essential for an energizing routine!!The music- it doesn't bother me, per se, but it is too loud.  And when the instructor stops talking, it gets even louder!  You can turn the music off on the audio setup, but then it's almost too quiet.  I like a bit of soft music in the background as a white noise that keeps you from focusing on the cars outside, the kids upstairs, the dryer buzzing, etc... I wish you could adjust the music volume separate from the instructor.I don't get the candles.  The studio is so bright you could perform surgery in there.  They don't really add any ambiance, they actually just look stupid because it's so bright in there.  They don't look aromatic; if they were then maybe I could see why they're using them.And your breathing should sound like Darth Vader?  Give me a break!  What a silly thing to say.  Plus, Vader is a total mouth breather and you should breathe through the nose.  If you're sounding like Vader something is wrong!There are too many people on the set, I think, and they all look like some uber-trendy yoga clique that want everyone to know how cool they are for doing yoga.  They look like some of the people I did yoga with in high school (early 90s) with their Hindu shirts from the local head shop, etc...The movements themselves are good.  It is a good routine for beginner to intermediate.  The flow would be better if the standing poses were done in the beginning (relaxation routine).  The instructor is a little chatty, but I've seen worse (YogaWorks) in the talking department, so that's not too big a deal for me.  I just feel the whole production is very contrived and showy.  Every great once in a while I'll do it for something different, or if I need a quick AM routine I'll do this one and add my own sun salutation to it- I still haven't found a good, short morning/energizing yoga set!Overall, not recommended. Pass this and go for Elena Brower!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I have done yoga on my wii using wii fitness and i really enjoyed it.  Sometimes its confusing to watch the people in cartoons.  Watching real people and them doing it and telling you what to do is so much easier to comprehend.  This was an excellent video though.  The best part is the ending stretches.  They make you feel totally at peace when there is none.  Yoga is still kind of hard for me because I tend to breath out of my mouth most of the time.  You are supposed to be breathing in/out your nose the entire time and that is still a little hard for me.  I also have a tendency to over tension my muscles with stuff like this.  But I feel so much better just after doing this and much more flexible.  It is hard to see the women in the video lunge their whole body forward and wrap their hands around their feet when you can barely touch your feet.  Anyways, I run about 30 miles a week on average and if I incorporate this video into my running regime, my legs should feel better.  All these poses do wonders for stretching after running from what I am reading.  So if your a runner who has a sore body like me, do this entire video after your run for the day and you will feel great, I guarantee it.
summary: Fantastic if you know how to relax and breathe

reviewText: This DVD is easy enough for a beginner but with a nice variety of modern poses for more advanced yogis. (Yay!  No "sun salutation!"  I am so bored with that move.)  The music is soothing and relaxing.  The instructor is good, she takes you through the moves slowly, although at times her voice reminds me a bit of Olive Oil from "Popeye".  Unfortunately, the whole "candlelight" thing is a big let down--I was hoping for a dark, soothing, visually-interesting video, but instead it's a fully lit studio with just a bunch of candles around in "Big Lots" candle holders!  The only purpose they serve is to create a potential fire hazard.  So much for mood lighting.  Bummer.This video is also a little boring.  I found myself staring at my toes and thinking about getting a pedicure instead of focusing on my breath and movements.  (Perhaps though if I had been in more of a "relaxation" mood instead of trying to finish this Netflix DVD before the mail man arrived I would've appreciated it more.)Overall though, this is a quality production, with a 45 minute "candlelight" relaxation workout, and a bonus 15-minute "energizing" workout.  I would recommend Rodney Yee's "Power Yoga" over this one, but it's worth a rental.
summary: Relaxing, but was hoping for more candles/less light

reviewText: I have done Sara Ivanhoe's Crunch Yoga for several years and like it.  I purchased this just to expand yoga routines and to have something to do before bedtime.  I'm not disappointed.  This is definitely not advanced yoga -- but either am I.  Sara is encouraging, simple and direct in her explanations, and has a pleasant sounding voice.  I like the emphasis on breath which other yoga videos often forget.  My only complaint is that they surely could have found someone over 30 to participate in the video.  An older person could easily do this route and could have served as an "inspiration" for those of us over 50.  I will say that even though the video is cast with beautiful young faces (and bodies) their poses are not perfect -- several of them do the modified versions.  For someone looking for a simple routine, this could serve as a great introduction or as a nice change from more advanced routines.
summary: Relaxing, not too long, not too short

reviewText: This workout is visually stunning. Fuchsia mats have been spread around a wood floor in a room filled with vanilla candles. The candles are on the floor, up on stands, simply everywhere!The curtains flow gently between brick walls and in the background you can see an opaque glass window. Sara is wearing a beautiful blue top while everyone in the room is also wearing colors of equal beauty. Imagine violet, lime green, lemon yellow, orange and powdery blue.This workout reminds me of yoga in a temple. There is a spirituality about the entire workout that is different than the outdoor workouts or more strenuous vinyasa type workouts. This video tends to encourage you to relax more and look inward to encourage your inner beauty.The purpose of this workout is to teach you to relax at will. Halfway through the workout, I was ready to just climb into bed and sleep blissfully until morning. The music and candlelight allows the tension to drain from your body as you breathe deeply.The instructor has been doing yoga for a long time and she says learning to relax at will allows you to be in control of your energy. With Sara Ivanhoe giving you gentle instruction, you can stretch your way into tranquility. I loved her instruction, it was calming and you can see her inner beauty, calm and love for yoga.Some of the poses include: cat pose, arch curl, side stretch, downward dog, sitting twists, tree pose, butterfly stretch. You won't have to worry about doing the Chaturanga or anything that is stressful, fast or complicated. These poses melt the body into sleep and must have been chosen to release tension and improve balance and flexibility.You will need a sticky mat, a towel and a cushion. A strap can be used to help you move further into some of the poses.If you enjoy this workout, you might also want to take a look at MTV Yoga with Kristin Mc Gee, Ali MacGraw Yoga Mind and Body or Bed Top Yoga, which is a tape.This is a relaxing, gentle yoga routine for the evening before drifting off to sleep.~The Rebecca Review

Again, since I've had no previous experience with yoga I have nothing to compare this to.  This DVD was not too strenuous.  As a beginner there were a few moves I found a bit difficult to hold, but the instructor is great about constantly reminding you to not overdo it and has one person showing frequent modifications.I did find it to be rather relaxing.  I was either so relaxed or worn out afterward that I was certainly ready for bed!I do recommend as a relaxing yoga workout or as a cool down after a strenuous activity.  I also think it's perfect for beginners!

reviewText: This video was my introduction into yoga, what a great place to start. If you are looking for a strenuous video than this isn't what you want. But I highly recommend this to people who are new to yoga, or those more experienced who want a really soothing and relaxing video. Sara Ivanhoe is a great instructor, she isn't intimidating in the least, does a good job of explaining the postures as well as emphasizing the importance of breathing.You start out with breathing where Sara explains how to breathe, etc. Then you move into a vinyasa, which is a flowing series of postures coordinated with the breath. It gets you familiar with some of the terminology. Then you move into some simple postures that stretch you out nicely. Some of the poses are a little tricky, the tree pose is a balancing posture that I always have trouble with but I am getting better. There is also a nice shoulder stretch which isn't easy, then you finish out with runners lunge (stretch), then into some forward bends once with legs together, and then in a straddle position. My flexibility continues to improve with the forward bends. Then it's on to the final relaxation pose.All in all, a great video. Perfect for someone like me, and this video will do just as Sara says, leave you relaxed and rejuvenated.
summary: The video in my collection I do most often....
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is set in Crunche's studio with added candles & billowy long white curtains to set the mood. There are 5 woman 1 guy in the back all in good shape. Everyone is diff with diff flexibility. Each pose is held for a long time & the music is very light & simple w/ocassional nature sounds.You can see Sara has gotten better with the camera over the years, she's very compose, clam with gentle encoraging direction.The candlelight is about 40 min long starting with 5 min of intro & deep breathing. While sitting cross legged, there is a upright torso stretch, side torso stretch, sitting spinal twist & cross legged butterfly stretch for 5 min. Next is kneeling cat/cow, a kneeling modified moutain pose, child's pose & cow pose which is repeated a couple of times like a modified sun salutation for 5 min. Next is downward facing dog, standing  fwd bend, mountain pose w/arms & breathing & last, standing small spinal twist for 5 min. Next is tree pose (hard to do w/eyes closed), modified eagle only doing the hands for 4 min. Next is lunges to stretch the thighs, straight front leg stretch while kneeling for 5 min. Next is sitting straight leg fwd stretch, wide leged fwd stretch, butterly stretch & butterfly stretch for 5 min. Last is a laying down narative relaxation for 3 min, then knee to chest stretch & knees to side spinal twists, then quiet meditation for 2 min.Energizing 15 min: 2 min breathing, standing cat/cow, standing arm laced to open chest (felt good & never seen before), simple standing thigh stretch, squat, simple kneelig torso stretch, kneeling subltle backbend, sitting simple hand gesture mudra for 1-2 min & end with 1 min sitting meditation.There is a trailer at collagevideo com
summary: Relaxing good stretches for evening relaxing & bonus for waking up

reviewText: Ok, I don't know which dvd the reviewer was watching when she said that there were Fuchia mats and a beautiful set, but it wasn't this one. I expected the lights to be very low with just the candlelight to do the workout with. The set looks like a basketball court. But with that said there is plenty to keep you buzy with this DVD. The moves are a bit harder than they look and the Energizer workout really does work. This has benefits for all skill levels. I truly believe that a yoga dvd library must have many different types of yoga workouts for different days and different situations. I do love this DVD and appreciate the stress relief candelight yoga workout.
